Article Title: Starbucks manager applauds Zomato delivery agent carrying 2-year-old daughter to work: “He touched our hearts”
Article Text:
Here’s the post shared by Devendra Mehra

Today, a

Zomato

delivery boy came to our store Starbucks Khan Market, New Delhi to pick up an order. He touched our hearts. Despite facing challenges at home, he continues to work hard while caring for his little 2-year-old daughter with him during the work. He is a single parent raising his daughter. Seeing his dedication and love for his child was truly inspiring. We were honoured to offer her a small treat of babyccino, hoping to bring a little smile to her face. It reminded us of the strength and resilience of the human spirit, even in difficult times. We wish him and his daughter all the best, and we’re grateful for the small moments that remind us of the kindness and empathy that connect us all.

His name is Sonu.



Zomato responds to Mehra’s LinkedIn post

How internet reacted

A Zomato delivery agent is winning hearts on the internet for taking care of his two-year-old daughter while on work. Devendra Mehra, a Store Manager at Starbucks shared a post about Sonu on LinkedIn.In the post, Mehra recounted that he came across Sonu who was picking an order from Starbucks in Delhi's Khan Market. “Despite facing challenges at home, he continues to work hard while caring for his little 2-year-old daughter with him during the work,” he wrote.“He touched our hearts,” Mehra added.Commenting to the LinkedIn post, Zomato said “Hi Devendra! Thank you so much for sharing this touching story about Sonu. We’re deeply moved by his dedication and the strength he shows in his work. We’ll ensure your heartfelt appreciation is passed on to Sonu. His resilience and commitment truly embody the spirit of our team. Your kind gesture and recognition mean a lot to us.”Praising the gesture, a user said “Amazing! Right now, the world could use a little more empathy and help—small gestures that seem to be in short supply these days.""Stories likes these makes heart so full. See if you can find this man again as we can do fund raising for his daughter's education. I would be the first one to contribute," said another.
Article Summary: A Zomato delivery agent is winning hearts on the internet for taking care of his two-year-old daughter while on work. Devendra Mehra, a Store Manager at Starbucks shared a post about Sonu on LinkedIn. “Despite facing challenges at home, he continues to work hard while caring for his little 2-year old daughter with him during the work,” he wrote.

Article Title: Over 27,000 tech employees loses job in August 2024: Intel, Cisco, IBM, Apple and others cuts thousands of jobs
Article Text:
Intel announces 15,000 job cuts as chipmaker goes through toughest time in its history

Cisco to layoff around 6,000 employees in its second round of job cuts

IBM shuts down R&D operations in China, over 1,000 employees laid off

German chipmaker Infineon to cut 1,400 jobs, another 1,400 employees to be relocated

Action camera manufacturer GoPro lays off 15% of its staff, 140 employees to loose their jobs

Apple cuts 100 jobs in its services group



Dell cuts unspecified jobs in sales teams

Bengaluru-based fabric startup, Reshmandi laid off its entire staff

Web browser startup Brave cuts 27 jobs



ShareChat cuts 5% jobs

Tech companies continued to cut jobs at a rapid pace in August 2024. More than 27,000 workers in the industry lost their jobs as big tech companies like Intel , IBM , Cisco , and even smaller startups, comprising a total of over 40 companies announced layoffs. So far in 2024, over 136,000 tech workers have been laid off by 422 companies.Intel announced it would lay off 15,000 employees, representing over 15% of its workforce, in a memo to employees on Thursday.The layoffs are part of a $10 billion spending reduction plan for 2025, following a dismal second-quarter earnings report and outlook.CEO Pat Gelsinger blamed Intel’s revenue growth shortfall on high costs and low margins, despite its leadership in the CPU chip revolution 25 years ago. Annual revenues fell $24 billion between 2020 and 2023, while its workforce grew 10% during the same period.Cisco Systems is laying off about 7% of its global workforce, affecting around 6,000 employees, as it shifts focus to high-growth areas like AI and cybersecurity. This marks Cisco’s second major round of job cuts this year.CEO Chuck Robbins remains optimistic about rebounding demand for Cisco’s networking equipment. Cisco is pivoting to capitalise on emerging technologies, having committed $1 billion to invest in AI startups and recently acquired cybersecurity firm Splunk for $28 billion.As part of the restructuring, Cisco plans to combine its networking, security, and collaboration departments into a single organisation.IBM is discontinuing its research and development operations in China, resulting in the displacement of over 1,000 employees as reported by Chinese media outlet Yicai.IBM has been grappling with a decline in demand for IT hardware and difficulties in expanding its presence in China, a market that once held significant potential and provided a robust business base beyond the United States. Despite these challenges, IBM has affirmed that these changes will not compromise its ability to support customers in China. The company will now prioritise serving private enterprises and select multinationals within the Chinese market.Infineon, a German chipmaker, will cut 1,400 jobs and relocate another 1,400 to countries with lower labour costs, its CEO Jochen Hanebeck said. The company’s third-quarter revenue fell short of expectations, prompting a downgrade of its full-year forecast for the third time in months. Hanebeck attributed the slow recovery in target markets to prolonged weak economic momentum and excess inventory levels.Popular action camera manufacturer GoPro has announced a restructuring plan that involves reducing its workforce and eliminating approximately 15% of its current headcount, about 14o employees. The layoffs are expected to be completed by the end of 2024, reducing operating expenses by $50 million from projected fiscal 2024 expenses. Apple has laid off about 100 employees in its services group, primarily impacting the Apple Books app and Apple Bookstore teams. Engineering roles were also eliminated. The layoffs come as Apple shifts resources towards AI programs, viewing Apple Books as less of a priority. Despite the cuts, Apple News remains a key focus.Layoffs are uncommon at Apple, but this is not the first round. Earlier this year, Apple laid off about 600 employees in its Special Projects Group due to project closures. In January, Apple shuttered a 121-person AI team in San Diego. As of its latest filing, Apple reported 161,000 full-time equivalent employees. Apple declined to comment on the layoffs.Dell Technologies is reorganising its sales teams, including a new AI-focused group. Sales executives Bill Scannell and John Byrne wrote in a memo that Dell is becoming leaner by streamlining management and reprioritizing investments. Rumours are that the company laid off about 12,500 employees, or 10% of its worldwide workforce, but the same could not be confirmed.ReshaMandi has reportedly terminated its entire workforce, as reported by sources to Entrackr. The firm’s website has been inaccessible for a week, coinciding with the resignation of its auditor. “It’s all over for ReshaMandi,” a source told the outlet. “The company is struggling to pay liabilities and bear operational costs including salaries for the past several months.”Brave, a web browser and search startup, has laid off 27 employees across departments, as confirmed by TechCrunch. PitchBook estimates Brave has around 191 employees, representing a 14% reduction. These layoffs follow a similar move in October 2023, when Brave cut 9% of its workforce due to cost management in a challenging economic environment.ShareChat, a Bengaluru-based social media company, laid off about 5% of its workforce, about 30-40 employees, after a bi-annual performance review in the month of August 2024.
Article Summary: Intel announces 15,000 job cuts as chipmaker goes through toughest time in its history. Cisco to layoff around 6,000 employees in its second round of job cuts.IBM shuts down R&D operations in China, over 1,000 people laid off. German chipmaker Infineon will cut 1,400 jobs and relocate another 1, 400 to countries with lower labour costs.

Article Title: Apple event next week: Biggest design changes coming to iPhone 16 series
Article Text:
Bezels Go Thinner

New Camera Layout with a Pill-Shaped Camera Bump

Larger Sizes for the iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max

Two New Buttons

New Colors

Apple's iPhone 16 launch is likely right around the corner. Apple has sent out invites for “Glowtime” event on Monday September 9. While speculations suggest that Apple fans may have to wait longer for that 'Slim iPhone', there are likely to be some physical design changes in iPhone 16 series . This includes larger screens on the iPhone 16 Pro devices, thinner bezels and new camera design.Other than these there will be lots inside including new chip, brighter display, camera technology and more. Here we talk about the likely design changes.One of the most noticeable design changes in the iPhone 16 series is reported to be the significantly reduced bezel size, especially on the Pro and Pro Max models. This reduction in bezels will maximize the display area, providing users with more screen real estate and a more modern, sleek look.The iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus may feature a vertical camera orientation, similar to the iPhone 12 and 12 mini. This change is likely to accommodate spatial video recording, which can be viewed on the Vision Pro. Apple shifted from a vertical arrangement to a diagonal one starting with the iPhone 13 models. The company then said that doing so made it possible to fit a larger module in the device. So, while the exact reasons for the change is unclear, it's possible that the new orientation allows for a larger camera sensor.The iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max are expected to have larger screens compared to iPhone 15 series models. While iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max models have 6.1 and 6.7 inch screens, the iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max might be 6.2 or 6.3 inch and 6.8 or 6.9 inch, respectively.The iPhone 16 series will introduce two new buttons: A replacement for the Mute Switch and a completely new button. Also, the Action Button in iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max models is likely to be expanded to the standard iPhone 16 models. This button can perform various functions like activating the Flashlight, turning on the Camera, launching Shortcuts, and more.While there have been conflicting rumors about the color options for the iPhone 16 series, it seems that the final choices colours may include black, green, pink, blue, and white. Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo believes the iPhone 16 may not have the purple and yellow colour options.
Article Summary: Apple has sent out invites for “Glowtime” event on Monday September 9. There are likely to be some physical design changes in iPhone 16 series. This includes larger screens on the iPhone 16 Pro devices, thinner bezels and new camera design.

Article Title: Tata Sons repays Rs 20,000-crore debt to 'avoid' going public: Reduces stake in TCS and more
Article Text: Tata Sons has voluntarily surrendered its registration certificate to the RBI after repaying over Rs 20,000 crore in debt. This strategic decision allows it to remain unlisted. Additionally, Tata Sons sold shares in TCS and received substantial dividends from its listed companies such as TCS, Tata Motors, and Tata Steel.
Article Summary: Tata Sons voluntarily surrendered its registration certificate to the RBI after repaying over Rs 20,000 crore in debt. This strategic decision allows it to remain unlisted. Tata Sons sold shares in TCS and received substantial dividends from its listed companies such as TCS, Tata Motors and Tata Steel.

Article Title: Microsoft’s hiring of Inflection staff: Company gets ‘second good news’ in 3 months
Article Text:
Why CMA cleared Microsoft’s hiring of Inflection staff

CMA gives green light to Microsoft-Mistral AI deal in May

Microsoft's decision to hire staff from the Inflection AI startup to join its new AI unit raised concerns in the UK, prompting an investigation into potential competition reduction. However, after a month-long initial inquiry, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority ( CMA ) has given Microsoft the green light, clearing the company of any wrongdoing in reducing competition.“The CMA has cleared Microsoft’s hiring of certain former employees of Inflection and its entry into associated arrangement with Inflection,” the regulator said.In March, the tech giant hired Mustafa Suleyman, co-founder of Google DeepMind , as head of its newly-created AI unit, along with a number of employees from the startup as a part of the deal which is reported to have cost the Windows-maker $650 million.The CMA had set a September 11 deadline to decide whether the investigation will progress into a second phase.According to a post by Joel Bamford, executive director, CMA, on LinkedIn, “the evidence did not show competition concerns requiring a more in-depth Phase 2 review”.“ Inflection AI is not a strong competitor to the consumer chatbots that Microsoft has developed directly (Copilot) and in partnership with OpenAI (ChatGPT). On this basis, we cleared the transaction,” he added.Back in May, the CMA announced it will not launch a formal investigation into the partnership between Microsoft and Mistral AI , a French AI startup that received a $16 million investment from Microsoft earlier this year.This decision came several weeks after the CMA sought feedback from the industry on the potential implications of this tie-up. Ultimately, the CMA concluded that the partnership didn't meet the criteria for a full-scale investigation under the UK's merger regulations.
Article Summary: UK's Competition and Markets Authority cleared Microsoft of any wrongdoing in reducing competition. Microsoft's decision to hire staff from the Inflection AI startup to join its new AI unit raised concerns in the UK. In March, the tech giant hired Mustafa Suleyman, co-founder of Google DeepMind, as head of its newly-created AI unit.

Article Title: After Google and Microsoft, this AI tool is preventing users from creating ‘fake' photos of US politicians
Article Text:
Midjourney’s new policy for US elections



“I don’t really care about political speech. That’s not the purpose of Midjourney. It’s not that interesting to me. That said, I also don’t want to spend all of my time trying to police political speech. So we’re going to have put our foot down on it a bit. Anybody who’s scared about fake images in 2024 is going to have a hard 2028. It will be a very different world at that point. Like, obviously you’re still going to have humans running for president in 2028, but they won’t be purely human anymore.”

What researchers said about Midjourney’s previous policy



Artificial intelligence (AI)-based image generator Midjourney has reportedly started blocking users from creating ‘fake’ images of US politicians ahead of the upcoming presidential elections . According to a report by the news agency The Associated Press, attempts to generate images of prominent figures such as President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump have been unsuccessful. When users tried to create an image of "Trump and Biden shaking hands at the beach," the tool displayed a “Banned Prompt Detected” warning.A second attempt led to an escalated warning stating, “You have triggered an abuse alert,” the report added.In a recent digital office hours event on Discord, Midjourney CEO David Holz addressed the users of the platform to announce that with the election in full swing, it’s time to “put some foots down on election-related stuff for a bit.” He also noted that “this moderation stuff is kind of hard,” however, he didn’t outline exactly what policy changes were taking place. He described the clampdown as a temporary measure to make it harder for people to abuse the tool.Holz said:With only 11 employees Midjourney has remained largely silent on the growing concern about how generative AI tools can be used to spread election misinformation. Unlike other major image-generating companies, Midjourney did not sign a voluntary industry agreement in February to address the issue of AI-generated deepfakes .A recent report by the Center for Countering Digital Hate found that Midjourney's tools are already being used to create misleading images that could support disinformation campaigns or false claims about elections.
Article Summary: Artificial intelligence (AI)-based image generator Midjourney has reportedly started blocking users from creating ‘fake’ images of US politicians ahead of the upcoming presidential elections. CEO David Holz addressed the users of the platform to announce that with the election in full swing, it’s time to “put some foots down on election-related stuff for a bit”

Article Title: Why Google's next big legal challenge may start this month
Article Text:
What US DoJ is investigating in Google’s ad business



What Google said about the upcoming trial



The US is set to launch a second antitrust case against Alphabet-owned Google next week. The trial, led by the US Department of Justice (DoJ), will scrutinise the advertising system that Google uses to generate revenue, which prosecutors claim negatively impacts news publishers. Scheduled to take place in Alexandria, Virginia, the trial will examine Google's technology that links website publishers with advertisers.In 2023, these tools were responsible for generating over 75% of Google's $307.4 billion advertising revenue.According to a Reuters report, the Justice Department and a coalition of states will seek to prove that Google violated U.S. antitrust laws through its digital advertising businesses. Regulators accused the company of dominating the market for digital ad technology by integrating its tools for publishers and advertisers, thereby securing a "privileged position as the middleman."The Justice Department alleged that Google controls 91% of the market for ad servers, over 85% of the market for ad networks, and more than half of the ad exchange market.Potential witnesses for the trial may include competitors such as Trade Desk and Comcast, as well as publishers like PubMatic. The case will also examine how Google's advertising technology has impacted news organisations.A study from Northwestern University published in November 2023 noted that one-third of U.S. newspapers have closed or been sold since 2005. Executives from News Corp, the Daily Mail, and Gannett, all of whom have also sued Google, could testify during the trial.A victory for the states and the Justice Department could pave the way for them to request that US District Judge Leonie Brinkema order a breakup of Google's business.Google has refuted these claims, arguing that it is not obligated to share its technological advantages with competitors and that its products are compatible with those from other companies.The company highlighted that its market share is 30% or less when accounting for advertising on social media, streaming TV, and apps. Google also contends that the Justice Department's focus on website ads overlooks the competitive landscape in these growing categories.The trial will scrutinise Google's perspective on its ad tech, with potential testimony from over two dozen current and former employees, including YouTube CEO Neal Mohan , a former Google advertising executive. The company has also emphasised its support for small businesses and publishers, some of whom it intends to call as witnesses.Google even warned that a breakup could "slow innovation, increase advertising costs, and make it more difficult" for small businesses to grow.
Article Summary: The US is set to launch a second antitrust case against Alphabet-owned Google next week. The trial, led by the US Department of Justice (DoJ), will scrutinise the advertising system that Google uses to generate revenue. The case will also examine how Google's advertising technology has impacted news organisations.

The widely popular Telegram-based crypto tap-to-earn game has just revealed the code word and card combinations that could earn you up to 6 million tokens for free.Since its launch in March 2024, Hamster Kombat has seen explosive growth, attracting over 200 million users globally. The viral clicker game centres around a Hamster who acts as the CEO of a simulated virtual crypto exchange.Players are tasked with supporting this ambitious rodent by mining coins and upgrading the exchange’s level.As a reward for their efforts, players can earn free bonuses. Mining in Hamster Kombat is simple—just tap on the Hamster icon until your energy bar is depleted.The Daily Cipher Code and Combo Card are special challenges within the game designed to reward players with even more tokens. The Daily Cipher Code is a task where players must decipher a word using Morse code. Successfully cracking the code within the 24-hour time limit can earn you 1 million coins.The Daily Combo Card is a challenge that requires players to correctly choose three cards from the game’s upgrade categories: PR & Team, Markets, Legal, Specials, and Web3. Completing this challenge can net you an additional 5 million coins. Like the Cipher Code, the Combo Card is updated daily.The Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher code for today is “WITHDRAW.” Enter the code using the Morse sheet given below and earn up to 1 million coins.▬ Long Tap● Short TapW: ● ▬ ▬I: ● ●T: ▬H: ● ● ● ●D: ▬ ● ●R: ● ▬ ●A: ● ▬W: ● ▬ ▬To activate the Daily Cipher mode, simply go to the "Exchange" tab and press the "Daily Cipher" button. Once activated, enter the daily Morse code using the following tapping patterns:
Article Summary: Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher code for September 03, 2024 is WITHDRAW. Today's morse code is: WIT HDRAW. To solve today’s cipher:Tap once for a dot (•).Tap and hold for a dash (—).Wait at least 1.5 seconds between each letter sequence to ensure proper registration in the game.

Similar to Hamster Kombat, TapSwap offers players the chance to earn cryptocurrency by tapping, completing tasks, and engaging in various in-game activities. With its user-friendly design and enticing crypto rewards, the platform has drawn a global audience of over 60 million.By blending entertainment with financial incentives, TapSwap has made a significant mark on the mobile gaming industry.TapSwap is an interactive tap-to-earn game accessible through Telegram’s mini apps for both iOS and Android devices. Players earn points by tapping a gold coin that appears in the centre of the screen. The game features a unique ‘Energy’ metre that depletes over time and slowly replenishes, adding a layer of strategy to the tapping process. Its straightforward gameplay makes TapSwap highly engaging and widely popular. The game has gained considerable attention for its daily codes, which offer bonus points or coins up to 400,000.Open your Telegram app and search for "TapSwap" or a related bot name. Select the official TapSwap bot from the search results.Once you’ve found the bot, click "Start" or a similar command to begin. You’ll typically see a virtual coin in the centre of the screen. Tap on the coin continuously to earn points or virtual coins.Tap frequently to accumulate points. Some TapSwap games might include additional features like daily bonuses, special missions, or power-ups to help you gather points more quickly.Once you’ve earned enough points, you can exchange them for rewards offered by the game, such as crypto tokens, virtual goods, or discounts on various products.Similar to the Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher and Hamster Kombat Daily Combo, TapSwap features Daily Codes that players can redeem for additional rewards. This system is crucial for enhancing in-game earnings and keeping player engagement high, with over 60 million active participants benefiting from these daily bonuses.
Article Summary: TapSwap is an interactive tap-to-earn game accessible through Telegram’s mini apps for both iOS and Android devices. Players earn points by tapping a gold coin that appears in the centre of the screen. The game has gained considerable attention for its daily codes, which offer bonus points or coins up to 400,000.

Article Title: How Tinder, Bumble and other dating apps are using AI to help Gen Z ‘flirt’ online
Article Text:
AI chatbot to work like virtual ‘wingman’

Tinder and Bumble exploring AI-powered profile building tools

Online dating platforms including Tinder , Hinge , Bumble and Grindr are turning to AI to combat dating app fatigue among Gen Z users. The report noted that the move aims to bring disappointed daters back on the platforms and AI chatbots provide them personalised advice.“AI is going to help people make better connections. It’s that friend in the bar who’s helping you to ask someone out — but in the virtual context,” the Financial Times quoted Grindr chief product officer AJ Balance, as saying.These platforms are developing or testing AI chatbots and tools to act as virtual 'wingmen'.These AI tools will offer assistance to Gen Z users in crafting compelling chat-up lines, building attractive profiles and even providing feedback on flirting techniques.“The idea of a wingman talking to someone else’s wingman, maybe to see what it’d be like to go on a date or to find common areas of interest, is something that’s worth exploring,” he added.Tinder and Bumble are also exploring AI's potential. Tinder says that it aims to use AI “to support daters throughout the entire dating journey” within “the coming 12 months”.Tinder is also testing an AI profile-building tool with a limited rollout. The tool is designed to alleviate “the burden of photo selection”, which scans a user’s personal photos and selects the best images. Bumble is also developing a similar feature.Meanwhile, Hinge is developing an AI chatbot to provide feedback on user responses to profile prompts.Hinge said it is also looking to achieve its “ultimate goal” of letting user feel “like they have a personal matchmaker (driven by AI) inside the app”.
Article Summary: Tinder and Bumble exploring AI-powered profile building tools. Hinge is developing an AI chatbot to provide feedback on user responses to profile prompts. Tinder says it aims to use AI ‘to support daters throughout the entire dating journey’ within ‘the coming 12 months’

Article Title: Elon Musk questions possible arson after fire ravages historic French church; here’s his post on X
Article Text:
Church’s architectural significance

Elon Musk’s reaction on social media

Official response and investigation

Also read

In the early hours of the morning, a devastating fire severely damaged the Church of the Immaculate Conception in Saint-Omer, France. This historic 19th-century church, known for its exquisite neo-Gothic architecture, suffered extensive damage as the blaze engulfed the building, leading to the collapse of its iconic steeple and bell tower. The fire, which required the efforts of over 90 firefighters to control, has left the community in shock.Fortunately, no injuries were reported, but the loss to this architectural gem is immense.The Church of the Immaculate Conception, completed in the late 1800s, is celebrated for its neo-Gothic design, which includes soaring spires, intricate stone carvings, and stunning stained glass windows. The church has long been a symbol of Saint-Omer's rich cultural and religious heritage. Its towering steeple and bell tower were among its most distinctive features, drawing visitors and worshippers alike. The destruction of these elements marks a significant loss for both the local community and architectural enthusiasts worldwide.The news of the fire quickly spread, catching the attention of many, including tech billionaire Elon Musk. Musk, known for his active presence on social media, reacted by sharing a video of the burning church on his platform X (formerly Twitter). In his post, Musk raised the question of whether the fire could have been an act of arson, sparking widespread discussion and speculation online. His post has garnered significant attention, with many users engaging in the debate over the possible causes of the fire.Following the incident, France’s Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin expressed his condolences to the Catholics and residents of Saint-Omer, acknowledging the profound loss to the community. He assured the public that a thorough investigation is underway to determine the cause of the fire. While no official statement has been made regarding the possibility of arson, the investigation will explore all potential leads to uncover the truth behind this tragic event.The fire at the Church of the Immaculate Conception has left the residents of Saint-Omer grappling with the loss of a beloved landmark. The church has not only been a place of worship but also a cornerstone of the town's identity. In the aftermath of the fire, the local community has rallied together, expressing their grief and support for efforts to rebuild and restore the church.As the investigation continues, there is hope that the cause of the fire will be determined, allowing the community to begin the healing process. Whether the fire was a tragic accident or the result of foul play, the loss of such an important cultural and religious site is deeply felt. The future of the Church of the Immaculate Conception remains uncertain, but the resolve of the Saint-Omer community to preserve their heritage is clear.In the days to come, the focus will likely shift to recovery and rebuilding efforts, with the possibility of international support for the restoration of this historic site. The church’s significance extends beyond its religious role, representing a link to the past and a beacon of architectural beauty that has inspired many. The world will be watching closely as the investigation unfolds and as the people of Saint-Omer work to restore what has been lost.
Article Summary: A fire destroyed the Church of the Immaculate Conception in Saint-Omer, France. The 19th-century church is known for its neo-Gothic design and steeple and bell tower. Tech billionaire Elon Musk shared a video of the fire on his social media platform X (formerly Twitter) Musk raised the question of whether the fire could have been an act of arson.

Article Title: Did Pavel Durov went under the knife? His transformation raises eyebrows
Article Text:
Pavel Durov's rise to fame

Durov's recent legal troubles

Pavel Durov’s transformation: Then vs. Now

Social media reactions on Durov’s transformation

Impact of public scrutiny

Also read

Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram , has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance. Adding to the intrigue, Durov was recently arrested in France, raising further questions about the man behind the popular messaging app.Pavel Durov, a 39-year-old entrepreneur originally from Russia, is best known as the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013.Telegram quickly gained popularity for its strong emphasis on user privacy, offering end-to-end encryption and other security features that set it apart from competitors. As of now, Forbes estimates Durov's net worth to be around $15.5 billion. Despite his success in the tech industry, Durov has managed to maintain a relatively low profile—until now.Durov's recent arrest in Paris has added a new layer of complexity to his public image. He was detained in France on charges of suspected complicity in running an online platform involved in illicit activities, including child exploitation, drug trafficking, and fraud. While these allegations are serious, it is the sudden focus on Durov's physical transformation that has captured the internet's attention.Pavel Durov has been active on social media platforms like Instagram since 2011, regularly sharing photos from his travels around the world. In his recent posts, Durov appears with a full head of hair and a toned physique, often posing shirtless in various locations. However, these recent images stand in stark contrast to older photos where Durov was seen with a noticeably receding hairline.The drastic change in his appearance has fueled rumours that Durov may have undergone plastic surgery, including a possible hair transplant. A popular post on X (formerly Twitter) by a well-known account shared a side-by-side comparison of Durov's old and new photos, sparking a flurry of online discussions. The post reads, "Pavel Durov (Telegram CEO) before his hair transplant and plastic surgery," and has since gone viral.The speculation around Durov's transformation has been met with a variety of opinions online. On Reddit, users have debated whether the changes in Durov's appearance are the result of surgical procedures or simply better grooming and styling.One Reddit user commented, "This isn't a hair transplant. His hair is too thick and full to have this kind of drastic change from a HT. Most likely he's wearing a hair system (wig)."Another user added, "There's speculation that it's not a transplant, but rather a hair system because his hair loss was much more advanced in the first picture, so when the operation happens, the resulting hairdo never looks as full as his."Some users believe the changes are the result of plastic surgery, with one theorising, "This is well-done surgery."However, not everyone is convinced that surgery is involved. One Reddit user opined, "Honestly, I think a lot of the facial 'changes' are simply due to the much better angle and lighting in the second photo."As the speculation continues, it's clear that Durov's transformation—whether natural or assisted—has caught the public's eye. The intense scrutiny of his appearance highlights the challenges that come with being in the spotlight, especially for someone as private as Durov. Whether or not he has undergone any procedures, the discussions around his looks reflect a broader societal fascination with image and success.
Article Summary: Pavel Durov, 39, is the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013. He has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance.

Article Title: This premium OnePlus gets ‘cheaper’: New price, offer and more
Article Text:
New price

OnePlus 12R spécifications

A recent online report revealed that OnePlus may soon launch its next generation flagship smartphone — OnePlus 13. However, ahead of the flagship launch, the Chinese smartphone maker has slashed the price of its premium smartphone — OnePlus 12R .Launched earlier this year, OnePlus 12R has witnessed a price cut in India making it more affordable. The smartphone comes in three variants — 8GB+128GB, 16GB+256GB and 8GB+256GB.The company has only slashed the price of the 8GB+128GB variant.OnePlus launched the OnePlus 12R in India in January this year. The 8GB+128GB version of the smartphone was price at Rs 39,999. The 128GB variant of OnePlus 12R has received a price cut of Rs 2,000 and it is now available at Rs 37,999. The smartphone can be purchased in Cool Blue, Iron Grey and Sunset Dune colour options. Customers purchasing the smartphone can avail benefits worth Rs 2,250 on JioPlus postpaid plans.The OnePlus 12R comes with a 6.78-inch AMOLED display featuring a 120Hz refresh rate and LTPO 4.0 technology. The screen supports an adaptive refresh rate and reaches a peak brightness of 4500 nits, all protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.Under the hood, the OnePlus 12R is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 octa-core chipset (4nm) and the Trinity Engine, paired with 8GB of LPDDR5X RAM and 128GB of UFS 4.0 storage. The device sports a triple rear camera setup, including a 50MP Sony IMX890 main sensor, along with ultra-wide and macro lenses, and a 16MP front-facing camera.The smartphone also includes the Cryo-Velocity Cooling System, which utilizes advanced graphite and dual vapor chambers for optimal heat dissipation. It is powered by a 5,500mAh battery with support for 100W SUPERVOOC charging, enabling a full charge in just 26 minutes.
Article Summary: The company has only slashed the price of the 8GB+128GB variant. Customers purchasing the smartphone can avail benefits worth Rs 2,250 on JioPlus postpaid plans. The smartphone can be purchased in Cool Blue, Iron Grey and Sunset Dune colour options.

Article Title: When Tesla CEO Elon Musk called Ratan Tata a “gentleman and …”
Article Text:
Tata Nano and the Indian automobile market

Elon Musk praised Ratan Tata

The legacy of the Tata Nano

Also read

In the realm of business and innovation, few figures command as much respect as Tata Group chairman emeritus Ratan Tata. His influence extends far beyond the Indian corporate world, even garnering admiration from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose , Musk praised Ratan Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar." This moment has recently resurfaced, shedding light on Musk's appreciation for Ratan Tata and his ambitious project, the Tata Nano .The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time). The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. The idea was revolutionary—a small, affordable car that would cater to the vast Indian middle class, providing them with a safe and efficient means of transportation.In the interview with Charlie Rose, which took place shortly after the launch of the Tata Nano, the Tesla CEO was asked about his views on Ratan Tata’s efforts to introduce a low-cost car in India. The interview clip, which has recently gone viral, captures Musk's candid response."Take for a moment Ratan Tata, what he’s doing in India — developing a little sedan for $2300. Where do you put that in the whole equation of where the future of cars is?" asked Rose.Musk responded with a mix of admiration and caution. He began by acknowledging the brilliance behind the Tata Nano project and the character of Ratan Tata himself."I think it's a good idea to have affordable cars, but I think the problem with something like the Nano ... I wouldn't say problem because I think, by the way, it is probably a great idea and Ratan is a gentleman and scholar," Musk said.However, Musk also expressed his concerns about the long-term viability of such a low-cost vehicle, particularly in the context of rising fuel prices. He pointed out that while the initial purchase cost of the Nano was remarkably low, the cost of running the car—particularly fuel costs—could become a significant issue as gasoline prices continued to rise."But where it’s going to become challenging in the future is when the price of gasoline rises, the cost of acquiring the car is much less of an issue than the cost of running the car," the billionnaire explained.Despite the initial excitement surrounding the Tata Nano, the car faced numerous challenges. One of the most significant issues was its branding. While the Nano was intended to be an affordable vehicle for the masses, it was often labeled as "cheap" rather than "affordable." This perception problem, combined with safety concerns and competition from other small cars, led to unimpressive sales figures.The Nano’s production was ultimately discontinued in 2018, marking the end of what was initially seen as a groundbreaking project. The car's journey from inception to discontinuation is often cited as one of the biggest marketing failures in the automobile industry.
Article Summary: The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time) The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose, Musk praised Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar"

Article Title: Watch: Anand Mahindra shares video of Gujaratis doing garba in water, internet reacts
Article Text:
“Gujarat aur Garba, Ek gazab ka rishta (an amazing relationship)…Unstoppable,”

Take a look at the video here:

How X users reacted to the post



“This is how billionaires make Indian feel they are one of them: Romanticize crippled infra of the country,”

“Bro is tweeting this in his luxury 20bhk apartment,”

“It is a shame that these bunch of media fans did not know that they were dancing in gutter water and that lots of others must have life-saving issues, food needs, and medical help: this is a weird and senseless act, also insult to our dharma.”

A recent post by Tech Mahindra chairman Anand Mahindra on X (formerly known as Twitter) has sparked criticism from users. The billionaire industrialist shared a video showing people performing garba in knee-deep water in flood-affected Gujarat . While Mahindra did not mention the specific location, he commended the spirit of the people dancing amid severe waterlogging. The video comes in the wake of heavy rains in Gujarat, which have resulted in at least 47 deaths due to rain-related incidents in the region.Mahindra wrote in his X post,The post faced criticism amidst widespread infrastructure issues in India.With recent incidents of waterlogging, traffic disruptions, and electrocutions, many felt the post was insensitive to the hardships faced by people across the country. The post's positive tone contrasted sharply with the negative experiences shared by numerous social media users.Multiple X users slammed the post and pointed out how billionaires don’t have any issues with the country’s infrastructure facing challenges.a user named Harsh Vardhan wrote.another user named Siddesh Kumbhar pointed out.A third user named Nautamlal Mehta also criticised the ones that were dancing in the water. He wrote:Meanwhile, some X users also praised the video and acknowledged the group's strength in the face of adversity.
Article Summary: Anand Mahindra shared a video of people performing garba in flood-affected Gujarat. The video comes in the wake of heavy rains in Gujarat, which have resulted in at least 47 deaths due to rain-related incidents in the region. The post faced criticism amidst widespread infrastructure issues in India.

Article Title: Bengaluru-based Dunzo lays off 75% employees, reduces workforce to 50
Article Text:
Dunzo sends email to employees

Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. Citing unknown sources aware of the matter, the report said that the online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams.The job cuts , according to the report, is part of the company's broader effort to curb costs and create cash flow to address mounting liabilities, including overdue salaries to current and former employees and outstanding vendor payments. Layoffs .fyi - the online tracker show that the job cuts were made on August 31, 2024.As per the report, Dunzo has sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent downsizing. In the letter, Dunzo promises to pay pending salaries, severance, leave encashment, and other dues to affected staff as soon as it secures the necessary funds.Dunzo, which started as a concierge service, has undergone multiple shifts and challenges. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round. In May this year, Dunzo was reportedly close to securing $22-25 million through a mix of equity and debt from both new and existing investors.In mid-July this year, the company informed its employees that it was in the final stages of closing a deal, expecting to settle dues within 10-15 days. However, the transaction failed to materialize with subsequent emails revealing persistent delays and challenges.The company is now seeking to diversify its revenue sources beyond its primary merchant-focused operations.
Article Summary: Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. The online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round.
